body_html: @vadimkantorov as a data point, my experience binding cuSPARSE for solving large sparse linear systems (for exactly the laplacian smoothing cases you mentioned) on the GPU was disappointing, and it was way faster to compute it on the CPU using scipy.
body_text: @vadimkantorov as a data point, my experience binding cuSPARSE for solving large sparse linear systems (for exactly the laplacian smoothing cases you mentioned) on the GPU was disappointing, and it was way faster to compute it on the CPU using scipy.
body: @vadimkantorov as a data point, my experience binding cuSPARSE for solving large sparse linear systems (for exactly the laplacian smoothing cases you mentioned) on the GPU was disappointing, and it was way faster to compute it on the CPU using scipy.
